SENT.plain: We report a male patient with neuro-Behçet's disease who had somnolence, mild motor aphasia and periodic lateralized epileptiform discharge
SPECT study showed decreased cerebral blood flow in the left frontal and temporal lobes
An MRI scan of the head showed only mild brain stem atrophy
His clinical signs were markedly improved after administration of prednisolone

We propose that some cases of neuro-Beh,cet's disease may have very similar clinical features to herpes simplex encephalitis and that SPECT and MRI examinations can be very useful in distinguishing the ischemic lesion of neuro-Behçet's from the inflammatory lesion of herpes simplex encephalitis
